intro: Spiesia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and covered in small glands, giving it a distinctive appearance. Spiesia glandulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant yellow flowers.
